revision.comment: Notification of altered sources needing review #IABot (v1.2.6)
revision.text: {{Talk header}} {{DYK talk|6 November|2009|{{*mp}}... that Polish general [[Józef Haller de Hallenburg]] faked his death in the 1918 '''[[Battle of Kaniów]]'''?}} {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject Military history|class=B|B1=y|B2=y|B3=y|B4=y|B5=y|WWI=yes|German=yes|Polish=yes}} {{WikiProject Germany|class=B|importance=low}} {{WikiProject Poland|class=B | b1 = yes | b2 = yes | b3 = yes | b4 = yes | b5 = yes|importance=mid}} }} ==Zierhold== I cannot find the first name of German general Zierhold. Perhaps it is in German language sources? --[[User:Piotrus|Piotr Konieczny aka Prokonsul Piotrus]]|[[User_talk:Piotrus| talk ]] 21:26, 31 October 2009 (UTC) == Surrender? == How did we get from "honorable capitulation" to "[h]alf of the Polish survivors were arrested and sent to [[prisoner of war]] camps, but the others managed to escape"? —[[User:the_ed17|Ed]] [[User talk:the_ed17|(talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/the_ed17|contribs)]] 23:21, 6 November 2009 (UTC) :If this "honorable capitulation" involved the Polish soldiers getting sent to POW camps, then just say that; they weren't 'arrested' in any sense of the word, they just surrendered (if what I say is true). —[[User:the_ed17|Ed]] [[User talk:the_ed17|(talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/the_ed17|contribs)]] 23:23, 6 November 2009 (UTC) ::Inconsistency in sources? I tried to find more about it but the detailed sources don't seem to be online. --[[User:Piotrus|Piotr Konieczny aka Prokonsul Piotrus]]|[[User_talk:Piotrus| talk ]] 06:54, 7 November 2009 (UTC) ==Casualties== It is said that the casualties in the battle section casualties were high on both sides and is confirmed in the infobox with 1,000 dead or wounded Polish. Later it is said in the aftermath section that only 150 Poles were killed or wounded. This is quite a difference and needs to be standardized. --Molestash 21:03, 18 November 2012 (UTC) ==B-class== Passed for WPPOLAND confirming a prior WPMILHIST review. --[[User:Piotrus|Piotr Konieczny aka Prokonsul Piotrus]]|[[User talk:Piotrus| reply here]] 21:35, 11 February 2013 (UTC) == Moveing == Any controversial moves should be done via [[WP:RM]]. It might be the case that "Battle of Kaniv" is the appropriate name for this article - that is, that is how it is primarily described in reliable English sources. I do realize that the town is in Ukraine but that doesn't automatically translate into reliable sources using that designation, especially since this was a battle between Polish and German forces. So it could go either way, but WP:RM is the way to do it.[[User:Volunteer Marek|Volunteer Marek]] ([[User talk:Volunteer Marek|talk]]) 20:20, 24 April 2014 (UTC) : As Volunteer Marek said, we should use any controversial move via [[WP:RM]]. [[User:Kmicic|Kmicic]] ([[User talk:Kmicic|talk]]) 10:27, 22 September 2015 (UTC) == External links modified == Hello fellow Wikipedians, I have just modified {{plural:1|one external link|1 external links}} on [[Battle of Kaniów]]. Please take a moment to review [https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?diff=prev&oldid=746647256 my edit]. If you have any questions, or need the bot to ignore the links, or the page altogether, please visit [[User:Cyberpower678/FaQs#InternetArchiveBot|this simple FaQ]] for additional information. I made the following changes: *Added archive https://web.archive.org/web/20141229192221/http://archiwumcaw.wp.mil.pl/biuletyn/b25/b25_6.pdf to http://archiwumcaw.wp.mil.pl/biuletyn/b25/b25_6.pdf When you have finished reviewing my changes, please set the ''checked'' parameter below to '''true''' or '''failed''' to let others know (documentation at {{tlx|Sourcecheck}}). {{sourcecheck|checked=false}} Cheers.—[[User:InternetArchiveBot|'''InternetArchiveBot''']] ([[User talk:InternetArchiveBot|Report bug]]) 17:33, 28 October 2016 (UTC)
